article.headline: Chicago St. 81, Binghamton 60
article.story: CHICAGO (AP) -- David Holston scored a game-high 20 points to lead Chicago State past Binghamton 81-60 on Saturday. Holston was one of four Chicago State (2-2) players in the double digits. John Cantrell chipped in 16 points and a game-high 13 rebounds. Carl Montgomery added 12 and Kevin Jones 10. Binghamton (1-2) started out sluggish and was never able to catch up, misfiring on nine of their first 10 shots and trailing 9-0 to start the game. Binghamton shot just 34 percent, compared with 49 percent for Chicago State, and were outrebounded 53-31. Richard Forbes led the Bearcats with 15 points, followed by Lazar Trifunovic, who had 13 points and a team-high eight rebounds. The Bearcats never led but managed a small rally with just over six minutes left in the first half to cut the Cougars' lead to 34-26. The Cougars opened the second half with a 12-4 run, ensuring a double-digit cushion the rest of the game.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
